element.name: Pearse Square by Bootle, Traditional Cache (2/1)
element.description: Located in a pleasant city centre park.
element.long-description:
Located off Pearse Street in Dublin's city centre, Pearse Square offers a pleasant break from the hustle and bustle of the many busy streets nearby. The Square is a rectangular open space of just over 0.5 hectare, overlooked by houses on three sides and with the fourth side opening onto Pearse Street. The square was formerly known as Queen Square and dates from 1839. In 1996, the Parks Division commenced a 2-year refurbishment programme, the design concept taking as its basis a formal layout which was noted on the 1838 Ordnance Survey map for the area.
A 3.5 metre-high contemporary bronze sculpture entitled "Harmony" by Sandra Bell forms the Square's centrepiece and the park was re-opened to the public on 2nd July 1998.
On a fine day the locals are playing football, shooting the breeze, or simply sitting on the steps outside their lovely Georgian homes. Pop in to the park and rest your feet!
The cache is a micro/small traditional cache. Please replace it as you found it, ensuring it is not visible. Beware of possible watching eyes in this residential area. Enjoy
source - Dublin City Council

ul.li:
2010-06-06T19:00:00Z : Found it by septicdec
Nice find after the night in istanbul in the grand canal theatre
great show
TFTC

2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
Nice box and not sooo easy, but no problem ;)
Inside was a small animal and the logbook is wet, but you can still write on it!
TFTC and kind regards from Austria, eve

2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
Found with eve1987 on our caching tour through Ireland. Good hide, didn't think we would find it at first but it wasn't so hard. TFTC GudrunXY

2010-05-30T09:49:39Z : Didn't find it by justpastone
Could not find this cache, but did get to enjoy a sunny Dublin morning in the park.

2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by OBCLAN
Our only dnf of the day. maybe better luck next time.

2007-08-22T07:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
A very very busy place at lunch time - but CMB50 and I persevered. We were just about to give up when we found it. So excited - fully expecting a FTF but alas it was not to be, we were beaten to it!

wpt.name: GC11YDN
wpt.desc: Pearse Square by Bootle, Traditional Cache (2/1)
